basics.name: Thibaud Colas
basics.label: Technical Lead
basics.summary:
I’m Thibaud, a Technical Lead specialized in Web technologies.

 I’m interested in impactful work that makes a difference, open-source software, and sharing my learnings with others. If you care about diverse communities and fighting the good fight, we’ll do great things together.

work.summary: Front-end leadership for a team of 10 developers. Oversight of web development projects, either CMS-driven or data-driven single-page apps. Strategic direction, technical architexture, training plans, sales and recruiting.
highlights: Oversight on 10+ API-driven web app projects, with React, API backends, and client-side routing
Oversight on 10+ content-driven site projects, with a CMS, front-end component library
Technical architecture and project planning for long-term build and maintenance projects
HR management, career progression, training oversight, hiring, and public relations
Front-end lead for a large-scale CMS redevelopment, built with a pattern library and headless CMS
Build of an advanced extensible rich text editor with React, Draft.js
Team standards definition - open-source contributions, code reviews rollout, performance targets

work.summary: Front-end development for websites and web apps, primarily with React, Django and Node. Mentoring and training for other front-end developers, R&D, tooling, and pre-sales activities.
highlights: Front-end lead for the kick-off of a new data-driven digital platform for a major New Zealand pension fund. Single-page app with React
Interactive data visualisation development (D3) for New Zealand’s statistics department and other statistics agencies
Other CMS-driven sites and apps for organisations such as NZ Red Cross and Kiwibank
QA expertise, roll out of systematic CI pipelines for all projects as well as front-end unit & integration tests
Switch to ES6 JavaScript and bundled modules with npm and Browserify, then Webpack
Participation to bids & proposals, marketing, hiring
JavaScript (ES2015+), React, D3, REST APIs, BEM, Express, Django, Wagtail, GitHub, CodeShip, Travis

work.summary: Team Lead during design and development of an e-commerce portal (six developers, 500 man-days). Consulting and technical expertise activities at all stages of the project.
highlights: International project with teams in France, Denmark, Sweden.
Frequent client meetings abroad and by telephone.
Participation to presales projects with innovative technology stacks (POCs with Angular, Polymer, Spring microservices).
Participation to the CGI Web Factory's Excellence Team, dedicated to improve tooling and processes throughout all projects.
Deployment of Selenium on the agency's Continuous Integration platform (Jenkins), available for all projects.
Mentoring of three interns.
LAMP, Drupal, JavaScript, Angular, jQuery, RWD, SOAP, REST, Jenkins, Selenium, Git, Redmine, JIRA, Scrum

work.summary: Web Application Development — Participation to PHP development projects with the CGI Web Factory, from design to maintenance.
highlights: Technical referee and Project Lead backup on two portal maintenance projects. Team of six developers.
Direct mentoring of two developers.
Improvement on functional regression rates by adding Selenium to the team's testing process.
Customer Satisfaction: 9.6/10
LAMP, Drupal, JavaScript, jQuery, RWD, SOAP, Jenkins, Selenium, Git

work.summary: Organization of three groups in a JavaScript class (Master's degree) and a Computer Science initiation class (Bachelor's degree).
highlights: Teaching of HTML, CSS, JavaScript

work.summary: Design and development of new features for Datalift, as part of an internship. Datalift is a linked data publication platform for the Semantic Web. Data Visualization and transformation in the SemWeb spirit.
highlights: This position required a high level of autonomy as the development team was scattered across France.
JEE, Jersey, Knockout, Bootstrap, D3, SPARQL, Sesame, RDF, Git

work.summary:
Integration, Development and Webmastering as part of an internship for the end of the DUT.
 
Contact with clients and teamwork with the Webmaster and designers.
highlights: PHP, MySQL, JS, jQuery, SEO, UX, accessibility, hosting, Photoshop

volunteer.summary: A Meetup.com group about Web Development, open to everyone from professionals to newcomers, creative types to technical. Each event explores a specific topic in the form of presentations, open discussions or workshops.
highlights: Local, english-speaking group of common interest
Meetups every month

volunteer.summary: A real-time link sharer using Firebase as its backend and AngularJS on the front-end.
highlights: Side-project built with friends to use together and to discover Firebase.
AngularJS, Firebase, RequireJS, Bootstrap, Gulp, Bower, npm

volunteer.summary: Cross-platform transportation app built with Sencha Touch and Cordova. Node.js backend dispatching transportation data from data repositories (time tables) and SOAP/REST services (real time data, weather data).
highlights: Built by a team of four during the Montpellier Unlimited Hackathon, won second prize.
Sencha Touch, Sass, Cordova, Node, SOAP, REST

volunteer.summary: Skimbo is a social-networks mash-up. It helps you manage your social networks, for example by viewing and posting to a lot of social feeds at once.
highlights: First started by the Froggies team for the TypeSafe contest, development continued during the Montpellier Start-up Weekend.
Scala, Play 2, AngularJS, Less, MongoDB, WebSockets

volunteer.summary: D4 is a Datalift module to visualize RDF statistical datasets using the DataCube ontology. D4 is built with Bootstrap, D3.js and CoffeeScript.
highlights: D4 was made as part of a Master's degree Web Development course.
JEE, Jersey, CoffeeScript, Knockout, Bootstrap, Underscore, D3, NVD3, SPARQL

awards.title: Startup Weekend Wellington Health 2015 – Second place
awards.summary: Arrived second with our "Paper Preen" project. An automated quality control / linting and reviewing tool for research papers, prototype built with React and a Node.js backend

awards.title: JS1K 2014 — Honorable Mention
awards.summary: Honorable Mention by the JS1K Jury for Dragonsnake, a mash-up between snake and fruit ninja written in less than 1K (1024 bytes) of JavaScript!

awards.title: Montpellier Unlimited Hackathon — Second Prize
awards.summary: Second Prize for a public transport route calculation app (handles tramway, buses and bikes) in the Montpellier Area. Cross-platform app built with Sencha Touch and Cordova. Node.js backend dispatching transportation data from data repositories (time tables) and SOAP/REST services (real time data, weather data).

publications.name: Springload Blog
publications.summary: Frequent contributor to Springload's blog. Posts on code, design, user experience, and remote work.

publications.name: Visualization Experiments
publications.summary: A group of little visualizations running in the browser.

publications.name: Public speaking
publications.summary: Public talks in either english or french, given at various events around the world.

references.name: Anthony Dardilhac - Project Lead, Head of tooling - CGI WebFactory
references.reference: Thibaud is an avid developer. He quickly grasps complex problems and goes beyond the expectations of his managers. Thanks to his great coaching skills and clear explanations, he helped his colleagues to improve themselves. It's a pleasure to work with him and I recommend him with my eyes closed.

references.name: Arnaud Paul - Project Lead, Open-Source Consultant - CGI WebFactory
references.reference:
An incredible analytical capability, an undeniable technical background and a great customer relationship.
Thibaud is a leader and he knows how to drive his team throughout the project.

references.name: Guillaume Kulakowski - Open-Source Solutions Expert, Head of the Technical Expertise Team - CGI WebFactory
references.reference:
Thibaud was an excellent intern and collaborator.
 Motivated and passionate, always on the lookout for new tools or processes to improve quality and productivity. Thibaud is also an excellent speaker able to animate interesting presentations and Lightning Talks, especially around JavaScript, Web Performance and Open-Source Solutions.
